button.label: Create Drop-Down List
button.supertip: Creates data validation for the currently selected range of a discrete list of values as a dropdown list. The values used must be stored in cells and are referred to by a dynamic named range. If the current selection has existing data validation or non-conformative values, the user will be asked to confirm if they want the existing data validation or values to be overwritten.

button.label: Copy
button.supertip: Copies the data validation from a source range to a target range. The source range is required to be a single cell and to have existing data validation. If the target range has any data validation, the user will be asked to confirm if they want the existing data validation to be overwritten.

button.label: Clear
button.supertip: Clears all data validation from the selected range.

button.label: Numeric
button.supertip: Creates data validation for numeric values for a target range of cells. If the target range has existing data validation or non-numerical values, the user will be asked to confirm if they want the existing data validation or values to be overwritten.

button.label: Yes/No
button.supertip: Creates data validation for Boolean values in the form of "Yes" and "No" for a target range of cells. If the target range has existing data validation or non-Boolean values, the user will be asked to confirm if they want the existing data validation or values to be overwritten.
Adjusts the width of all columns on the current spreadsheet to automatically fit their contents.
Resets the width of all columns on the current spreadsheet to their standard width.
Adjusts the height of all rows on the current spreadsheet to automatically fit their contents.
Resets the height of all rows on the current spreadsheet to their standard height.

button.label: Calculate Descriptive Statistics
button.supertip:
Calculates descriptive statistics for the values in a selected range of cells. The following are calculated for all values, regardless of data type: - Total number of values - Number of unique values - Mode (multiple values will be listed if applicable) - Mode Frequency
The following are calculated using only numerical values in the selected range: - Number of numerical values - Mean - Standard deviation - Minimum - 1st quartile - Median - 3rd quartile - Maximum - Range
Results are displayed in a user form which allows for copying to the clipboard.

button.label: Add Template Sheets
button.supertip: Displays a user form for adding template sheets to the current workbook. When an available template sheet is selected and added, it will be inserted after the currently selected spreadsheet. If the current sheet is empty, it will be deleted.

button.label: Import Tensile Test CSV
button.supertip: Imports data from a formatted tensile test CSV file into a corresponding template sheet in the current workbook. If a blank template sheet does not exist, one is created. The sheet is named according to the timestamp of the tensile test. Series for stress, strain, and strain rate are calculated and a stress-strain curve is plotted.

button.label: Import Employee JSON
button.supertip: Imports data from an employees JSON file into a corresponding template sheet in the current workbook. If a template sheet does not already exist, one is created. A new pair of columns is added to the template sheet for each JSON file.

button.label: Add Employees Manually
button.supertip: Displays a user form for manually adding employee data to a corresponding template sheet in the curren workbook. If a template sheet does not already exist, one is created. A new pair of columns is added to the template sheet for the data.

button.label: View UDF Documentation
button.supertip: Displays a user form for viewing documentation on included User Defined Functions. When a User Defined Function is selected, a message box with the documentation is displayed.

button.label: Export Tensile Test Template Sheet
button.supertip: Opens a file dialogue to select a folder, then saves the tensile test template sheet as an Excel workbook to the selected folder.

button.label: View Video Guide
button.supertip: Opens a YouTube video demonstrating the macros and forms in this add-in in your default web browser.

button.label: View Installation Guide
button.supertip: Opens a PDF of the general Excel Add-in installation guide in your default PDF viewing program.
